body.p:
The Slave Trade.—“It would be easy
to prove,” says Humboldt;“that the whole
of Archipelago of the West Indies,
which now comprise scarcely 2,400,000
negroes and mulattoes, (free and slaves)
—received from 1670 to 1825, nearly five
millions of Africans! In this revolting
calculation of the consumption of the hu-
man species, we have not included the
number of unfortunate slaves who have
perished in the passage or been thrown in
the sea as damaged merchandise.”
